thread.title: Burglars pose as construction workers
thread.title_full: Burglars pose as construction workers | www.kirotv.com

author: kirotv.com
title: Burglars pose as construction workers
text:
Men dressed as construction workers pushed their way into a South Seattle home Thursday afternoon.
The 80-year-old man who lives in the home said he opened the door because he thought the men were working on a construction site nearby and wanted to talk to him.
As soon as the door was open, the men pushed the resident to the side.
One man talked to the 80-year-old while the other searched the house.
The resident’s son arrived a few minutes later -- in time to see the men run out of the kitchen door.
He worried his dad was hurt and called 911.
. @SeattlePD investigating: S Fontanelle St/Seward Park Ave S -2 men broke into home w/man in 80s home @KIRO7Seattle pic.twitter.com/Bk0JiZoHsx
— Alison Grande (@AlisonKIRO7) October 8, 2015 Seattle police rushed to the home to investigate.
Firefighters arrived to examine the 80-year-old.
The resident’s son told KIRO 7 he was “scared -- because my dad is 80-years-old and I was worried for his safety. I was like, 'Dad if I had not just come home three or four minutes after they entered, what could have happened.’”
At this point they haven't been able to determine if the burglars had time to steal anything before they ran off.
"He's not physically injured in any way but it's not a good feeling -- knowing somebody just went through your house and there was nothing you could do about it," said the 80-year-old’s son.
The men drove off in a dark blue newer pickup truck.
>> KIRO 7's Alison Grande is working on the story for after the football game and at 11 p.m. on KIRO 7 News.
